Message: Physical drive {Id1} failed to read the configuration or returned corrupt data for storage pool {Id2}. As a result the in-memory configuration may not be the most recent copy of configuration. Return Code: {Status}
All physical drives failed to read the configuration or returned corrupt data for storage pool {Id}. As a result the pool will be inaccessible. Return Code: {Status}
Majority of the physical drives of storage pool {Id} failed a configuration update; which caused the pool to go into a failed state. Return Code: {Status}
The capacity consumption of the storage pool {Id} has exceeded the threshold limit set on the pool. Return Code: {Status}
The capacity consumption of the storage pool {Id} is now below the threshold limit set on the pool. Return Code: {Status}

Windows was unable to read the drive header for physical drive {Id}. If you know the drive is still usable; then resetting the drive health by using command line or GUI may clear this failure condition and enable you to reassign the drive to its storage pool. Return Code: {Status}
Physical drive {Id} has invalid meta-data. Resetting the health status; using command line or GUI; might bring the physical drive to the primordial pool. Return Code: {Status}
Physical drive {Id} has invalid meta-data. Resetting the health status; using command line or GUI; might resolve the issue. Return Code: {Status}
An IO failure has occurred on Physical drive {Id} Return Code: {Status}

Physical drive {Id1} failed to read the configuration or returned corrupt data for storage space {Id2}. As a result the in-memory configuration may not be the most recent copy of configuration. Return Code: {Status}
All pool drives failed to read the configuration or returned corrupt data for storage space {Id}. As a result the storage space will not attach. Return Code: {Status}
Majority of the pool drives hosting space meta-data for storage space {Id} failed a space meta-data update; which caused the storage pool to go in failed state. Return Code: {Status}
Drives hosting data for storage space {Id} have failed or are missing. As a result; no copy of data is available. Return Code: {Status}

One or more drives hosting data for storage space {Id} have failed or are missing. As a result; at least one copy of data is not available. However; at least one copy of data is still available. Return Code: {Status}

The attempt to map; or allocate more storage for; the storage space {Id} has failed. This is because there was a write failure involved in the updating the storage space metadata. Return Code: {Status}
The attempt to unmap or trim the storage space {Id} has failed. Return Code: {Status}
A repair attempt for storage space {Id} was initiated by the driver. Return Code: {Status}
